rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: North-facing entrance hall that welcomes the visitor while aligning with Vastu principles, offering a clear path towards the inner courtyard.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: Spacious living area adjacent to the entrance hall, designed for relaxation and social gatherings. Vastu compliant with north and east orientations.

rooms.name: Dining Area
rooms.description: A dedicated dining area that connects the living room to the kitchen, ensuring seamless functionality and energy flow.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: Well-equipped modern yet traditional Kerala-style kitchen integrated with the dining area. Considered for efficient space usage and Vastu alignment.

rooms.name: Guest Room
rooms.description: A private guest room ensuring privacy while maintaining connectivity with the living area. Suitable for occasional visitors and adheres to Vastu guidelines.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: Spacious master bedroom designed for optimal relaxation and sleep. Placed in a calm area to align with Vastu principles.

rooms.name: Bathroom
rooms.description: Attached to the master bedroom for convenience and privacy, ensuring proper drainage and ventilation as per local building norms.

rooms.name: Servant's Quarters
rooms.description: Dedicated space for the servantâ€™s quarters located away from the main living areas. This provides privacy and adherence to local norms.

rooms.name: Open Courtyard
rooms.description: Central courtyard that embodies the traditional Kerala Nalukettu design, promoting natural ventilation and light. Integral for energy flow in Vastu.

openings.name: Main Entrance Door
openings.description: North-facing entrance door that adheres to Vastu principles and provides a welcoming feel.

openings.name: Balcony Door
openings.description: Additional opening providing access to the open courtyard from the living room area.

notes: This design is based on a Traditional Kerala-style Nalukettu for a G+2 studio apartment cottage suitable as a bachelor pad, incorporating servant's quarters and a North-facing entrance.
All dimensions are approximate and should be further detailed in consultation with a professional architect and local building authorities.
